result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles J. Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles J. Smith in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Charles J. Smith in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF113, 15CM32, 16CF48 and 16CF163 @ 3:28 p.m. Agreement stated - 16CF163 Def will plead to ct 1 and ct 2. Ct 1 - 60 days jail, $1760 total fine and costs, 14 month revocation. Ct 2 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA, no possession or use of controlled substances except as prescribed, 60 days jail, court costs. Jail consecutive to OWI. 16CF48 - Def will plead to cts 2 and 4. Ct 2 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, same conditions as ct 2 of 16CF163 except no additional jail. Ct 4 - 30 days jail, court costs. Dismiss and read in all remaining cts in 16CF48, 16CF163 and all cts in 15CF113 and 15CM32. Atty Abernethy-Mays and Def agree. Request to speak is made by person in attendance. Statement by ADA Laufenberg. Discussion regarding allowing comments by T.N.  Plea quest. reviewed. 16CF163 ct 1 - no contest plea. Ct 2 - no contest plea. 16CF48 ct 2 - no contest plea. Ct 4 - no contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 16CF48 cts 1, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 & 10 and 16CF163 cts 3, 4, 5, & 6. 15CF113 ct 1 dismissed, cts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in. 15CF32 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Abernethy-Mays satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 16CF163 ct 1 OWI 2nd and ct 2 felony bail jumping as repeater. Court finds guilty of 16CF48 ct 2 and ct 4. Sentencing remarks by State. State will not make recommendation on whether Court should hear from T.N. Atty Abernethy-Mays makes statement. Court will allow. T.N. makes statement. Sentencing remarks by Atty Abernethy-Mays. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Court orders 16CF163 ct 1 - 60 days jail, $1710 total fine and costs, 14 month revocation, alcohol assessment and driver safety plan, Credit for 127 days served, sentence complete. Ct 2 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, no use or possession of controlled substances except as prescribed and ingested as prescribed. No contact w/R.X. Probation officer may lift if/when feels appropriate. 60 days jail, consecutive to ct 1. No credit for time served. Commence today. Court costs. DNA sample and surcharge. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Huber. 16CF48 ct 2 - 6 yrs prison, 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs ext supv, imposed and stayed. 2 yrs probation. Def eligible for earned release and challenge inc. Conditions of probation same as ct 2 of 16CF163 (clarified - except no conditional jail time). Court costs, DNA surcharge. Ct 4 - 30 days jail consecutive to all other, sentence complete, court costs, DNA surcharge. Total sentence credit is 145 days, applied to OWI and ct 4 of 16CF48. 77 days credit if revoked on 16CF163 ct 2 or 16CF48 ct 2 - credit may only be given once. Bond in 16CF48 apply to costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Statement by Def regarding no contact. Bond to be applied first to ct 4 of 16CF48 and then 16CF163 ct 1. pmt plan for balance, beginning first full month - 2/17.

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Charles J. Smith in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  called at 5:07pm  Cases called 16TR890, 16CF163, 16CF48. 15CF113 and 15CM32.  16CF163 def will waive right to preliminary hearing.  Bond forfeiture hearing will follow cases.  16CF48 does not have information filed, time limits have been waived.  16CF163 def requested timely preliminary.  Statement by Atty Abernethy-Mays.  Speedy trial requested for 16CF163.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed for 16CF163.  Court reviews form with def.  Def waives right to preliminary.  Court accepts waiver for 16CF163.  Court finds probable cause, bound over.  Information filed.  Waive reading.  Reserve jurisdicational objections.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will accpt not guilty pleas.  Counsel will be filing speedy trial demand.  All cases will be set for status conf.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:32 a.m. Def's motion to suppress filed. Dep. Eric Chernetski duly sworn on oath, testifies. Witness identifies Defendant. Off the record @ 9:35. Back on the record @ 9:36. Testimony continues. J. S., Probation Agent, duly sworn on oath, testifies by telephone. Arguments by Counsel. Findings by the Court. Motion denied. 15CM32 to track along.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF113 and 15CM32 @ 9:33 a.m. Motion to suppress - will need to be rescheduled. Off the record for scheduling.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Charles J. Smith in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF113 and 15CM32 @ 2:00 p.m. Atty Abernethy-Mays advises she has not been appointed on 15CM32. 15CF113 preliminary hearing - Dep. Eric Chernetski duly sworn on oath, testifies. Witness identifies Defendant. Arguments on bind-over. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, reserve all motions and enter not guilty pleas to all 3 cts. Court accepts pleas. Atty Abernethy-Mays addresses bond. Response by State. Court reserves right to reconsideration of bond if Defense wants to submit results of drug test. 15CM32 to follow.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
